entry.title: BIP process friction
entry.summary:
The communication reflects a sentiment familiar to those who have experienced the Y2K era, expressing a certain unease with two-digit year formats. This apprehension stems from the historical context of the Y2K bug, which caused concern at the turn of the millennium due to potential computer errors arising from the abbreviated year notation. Despite this, the tone suggests an acceptance or resignation towards moving on, highlighted by the use of contemporary slang in signing offâ€”demonstrating an effort to adapt and blend with newer generations who may not share the same historical experiences.
In essence, the message conveys a blend of reflection on past challenges associated with digital date formatting and a willingness to engage with current trends in communication.
